response_requirements.initial_response_description: Custodian shall permit inspection at reasonable times and furnish copies 'as promptly as possible'; no specific deadline
response_requirements.final_response_notes: Statute requires 'as promptly as possible' with no fixed timeline
response_requirements.extension_notes: No extension provision; general 'promptly as possible' standard applies

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: No charge for inspection; copies provided at actual reproduction cost only
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Actual cost of reproducing the public record; fees prescribed by law; policy is 'minimal cost' meaning actual reproduction cost

exemptions.description: Information transmitted between attorney and client in confidence for purpose of obtaining legal advice
Communications concerning matters within attorney-client privilege as recognized by courts
Tax information required to be kept confidential pursuant to G.S. 105-259
Communications required by law to be kept confidential or prohibited from disclosure by state or federal law
Records of ongoing criminal investigations when disclosure would jeopardize investigation
Certain economic development records involving negotiations and competitive information

appeal_process.first_level_notes: No formal administrative appeal process; enforcement through court action for mandamus or declaratory judgment
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: No statutory provision for attorney fees

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Any person may inspect public records; no requirement to state purpose or identity
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: No specific format required; custodian must permit inspection at reasonable times
requester_requirements.specific_format: Must identify records sought with reasonable specificity

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Custodian of public records has responsibility; each agency must designate Electronic Records Coordinator for electronic records management
agency_obligations.response_format_options: State agencies must implement electronic records management program
agency_obligations.liberal_construction: Policy that people may obtain copies free or at minimal cost

oversight_body.name: North Carolina Department of Natural and Cultural Resources - State Archives
oversight_body.role: Oversees records retention and destruction; provides records management guidance

primary_sources: North Carolina Public Records Act statutory text
NC State Archives records management guidance
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official North Carolina statute. No specific response timeline - statute requires records be furnished 'as promptly as possible' at 'reasonable times' with no fixed deadline. Fees limited to actual reproduction cost - policy is 'minimal cost' for the people to obtain their public records. No formal administrative appeal process. No attorney fees provision. Willful destruction of records is Class 1 misdemeanor. Strong policy that public records are property of the people. Electronic records management program required for state agencies with designated Electronic Records Coordinator.
